snippet: In court papers that attracted little attention, the Moreland Commission argued that it had “independent authority” beyond Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s control.
abstract: Moreland Commission, in legislation with legislators, asserts that it has 'independent authority' to make investigatory decisions beyond New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo's control; Cuomo abruptly shut down the anticorruption panel that he created in exchange for enhancements to state ethics laws.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and THOMAS KAPLAN

lead_paragraph: In court papers that attracted little attention, the Moreland Commission argued that it had “independent authority” beyond Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s control.

headline.main: Cuomo and Panel He Shut Differ on Its Independence
headline.print_headline: Cuomo and Panel He Shut Differ on Its Independence

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
